head.title: Agency Cracks Down On Unsafe Cabbies

hedline.hl1: Agency Cracks Down On Unsafe Cabbies

block.p: Arthur White (letter, Jan. 3) said he had not heard the Taxi and Limousine Commission "chastise its drivers for making illegal U-turns, passing red lights, parking in the middle of the street to discharge passengers, block bus stops, etc.":

Arthur White (letter, Jan. 3) said he had not heard the Taxi and Limousine Commission "chastise its drivers for making illegal U-turns, passing red lights, parking in the middle of the street to discharge passengers, block bus stops, etc.":

Since last June, the commission has effected a total revision of the curriculums at the privately administered taxi driver schools to emphasize safe driving. The T.L.C. has also put into effect its own final exam for license applicants, started using programs to identify problem cabbies and hundreds without valid driver's licenses, lowered the threshold for denial of a renewal hack application from 11 points on a license to 9, and applied a new threshold for hack license suspension after three violations of state vehicle and traffic laws.
The T.L.C. has also made efforts to make the consumer complaint process speedier and more user-friendly.
CHRISTOPHER R. LYNN Chairman Taxi and Limousine Commission New York, Jan. 3, 1996
